intro: Willoughbya rotunda, commonly known as the round-leaved willoughbya, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, round-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Willoughbya rotunda is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
